parameters.group:
*** Expert Mode allows access to some base parameters which don't directly affect system operation but affect other parameters.
*** Number of battery cells per battery block. In a normal 12 V lead-acid battery block there are 6 cells per block. If block is the same as cell, use value of 1.
*** Defines voltage version of the system as number of battery blocks per string. For 12 V battery blocks, value 4 of this parameter means a 48 V system.
*** Defines voltage group of rectifiers to be controlled. This value must match with the voltage group of the installed rectifiers. Rectifier voltage groups are: 2 for 24V, 4 for 48V etc. When ca. 12 V battery blocks are used, value of this parameter is equal to Voltage Version.
*** Internal
*** Nominal maximum current rating of the system. Also used as default value for current shunt nominal current settings.
*** Total capacity of batteries in Ampere-hours.
*** Enable/disable energy save mode. When enabled, a minimum number of rectifiers is used to supply power. The unused rectifiers are put into a standby mode. This increases overall system efficiency.
*** Enables/Disables support for inverter control and configuration.
*** Language selection for the local interface.
*** When enabled, user specified device names are shown in local display. If name hasn't been given, device's default name is used. When disabled, default names are used in the local display.
*** When enabled, Inverter AC output value is shown in local display's main page. When disabled, Rectifier DC output value is shown in local display's main page.
*** Local Interface system password. If the password is 0000, it will not be asked.

*** Defines maximum charge voltage per cell for all parameters. This value has to be higher than Minimum Cell Voltage.
*** Defines minimum charge voltage per cell for all parameters. This value has to be lower than Maximum Cell Voltage and higher than Minimum Cell Monitoring Voltage.
*** Defines minimum monitoring voltage per cell for all parameters. This value has to be lower than Minimum Cell Voltage.
*** Defines nominal cell voltage.
*** Defines float charge voltage per battery cell.
*** Defines boost charge voltage per battery cell.
*** Temperature compensation coefficient, volts per degree of celcius per cell.

*** Whether to enable DHCP support. DHCP can be used to obtain IP settings automatically from a network supporting DHCP. Note! Changing the setting will take effect after the logout.
*** IP Address for TCP/IP in format aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd. Note! Changing the IP address will take effect after the logout.
*** IP Netmask for TCP/IP in format aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd. Note! Changing the netmask will take effect after the logout.
*** IP address of gateway (router) for TCP/IP in format aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd. Note! Changing the gateway will take effect after the logout.
*** IP address of primary DNS server in format aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd.
*** IP address of secondary DNS server in format aaa.bbb.ccc.ddd.
*** Baud rate for serial port communications.
*** Number of data bits for serial port communications.
*** Parity checking mode for serial port communications.
*** Number of stop bits for serial port communications.
*** IP address (numeric or FQDN) of SMTP mail relay server. Single entry only.
*** Defines the alarm states which cause sending of an alarm email.
*** Period for sending alarm mails in hours/minutes.
*** The email address which is used as the sender of alarm emails.
*** Email address of alarm mail recipient.
*** SNMPv1/v2c Community name. Leave empty to disable.
*** SNMPv3 Engine ID. Leave empty to use MAC-address.
*** SNMPv3 Username.
*** SNMPv3 security level. Use to enable authentication and encryption.
*** SNMPv3 authentication algorithm: MD5 or SHA.
*** SNMPv3 authentication password. Minimum length is 8 characters.
*** SNMPv3 privacy (encryption) algorithm: DES or AES.
*** SNMPv3 privacy password. Minimum length is 8 characters. Leave empty to use same password as for authentication.
*** Switch to enable SNMP SET support. Enable only after configuring safe v2c community and v3 security parameters.
*** Specify the format of traps to send. Version 2c trap, version 3 trap or version 3 inform (confirmed trap).
*** IP address (numeric or FQDN) of SNMP NMS (Network Management Station), which is the host that will receive SNMP traps.
*** Alarm states which cause sending of per-alarm SNMP traps.
*** Period for sending alarm SNMP traps in minutes/seconds.
*** Enables or disables sending of alarm overview SNMP traps.
*** Enable/Disable EchoVault agent.
*** IP address (numeric or FQDN) of the primary EchoVault controller.
*** IP address (numeric or FQDN) of the secondary EchoVault controller. Optional parameter.
*** Selects the protocol used by the agent to connect to the controller.
*** Selects the port used by the agent to connect to the controller.
*** Password for the EchoAgent. On the first time you will need to use the registration password, after that the EchoVault controller will assign an agent-specific password.

*** Rectifier voltage during float charge. Float charge is the default charge state.
*** Defines whether Battery Charge Current Control is enabled.
*** Limit for total battery charge current. Rectifier output voltage is controlled to keep charge current below this limit. Battery current measurement devices have their invidual charge limits.
*** Control gain value for Charge Current Limit operating in fast mode. Smaller value makes charge current control more stable, bigger value makes it faster.
*** Control gain value for Charge Current Limit operating in slow mode. Smaller value makes charge current control more stable, bigger value makes it faster.
*** Internal use only.
*** Internal use only.
*** Internal use only.
*** Maximum Manual Boost Charge time.
*** Defines whether Periodic Boost Charge is enabled.
*** Maximum Periodic Boost Charge time.
*** Number of times Periodic Boost Charge is performed in a year.
*** Defines whether Automatic Boost Charge is enabled.
*** Maximum Automatic Boost Charge time.
*** Automatic Boost Charging is activated if battery charge current exceeds Start Current after a mains fault.
*** Automatic Boost Charging is deactivated if battery charge current drops below Stop Current.
*** Defines whether Remote Boost Charge is enabled.
*** Maximum Remote Boost Charge time.
*** When Enabled, RBC will remain active after start until time limit is reached, regardless of the state of the control signal. When Disabled, RBC will be stopped also when control signal deactivates.
*** Rectifier output voltage during Boost Charging.
*** Minimum battery temperature for Boost Charge operation.
*** Maximum battery temperature for Boost Charge operation.
*** Defines whether Temperature Compensation is enabled.
*** Temperature to voltage ratio of Temperature Compensation.
*** Maximum charge voltage when using Temperature Compensation.
*** Minimum charge voltage when using Temperature Compensation.
*** The temperature at which Temperature Compensation does not have effect on the charge voltage.

*** Manual Battery Test is stopped when battery voltage drops below Stop Voltage and Ignore Time has passed.
*** Manual Battery Test testing time in hours / minutes. The test ends successfully when the time limit is reached. The BT Ignore Time specifies the minimum value for this parameter.
*** Maximum battery discarge limit for Manual Battery Test in Ampere hours. The test ends successfully when the discharge limit is reached. Set to zero to disable the limit.
*** Defines whether Periodic Battery Test is enabled.
*** Number of times Periodic Battery Test is performed in a year.
*** Periodic Battery Test is stopped when battery voltage drops below Stop Voltage and Ignore Time has passed.
*** Periodic Battery Test testing time in hours / minutes. The test ends successfully when the time limit is reached. The BT Ignore Time specifies the minimum value for this parameter.
*** Maximum battery discarge limit for Periodic Battery Test in Ampere hours. The test ends successfully when the discharge limit is reached. Set to zero to disable the limit.
*** PBT can be started on Monday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Tuesday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Wednesday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Thursday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Friday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Saturday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT can be started on Sunday in this time window (starthour:startminutes - stophour:stopminutes).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** PBT is not allowed to start in this day of the year (month.day).
*** Defines whether Natural Battery Test is enabled.
*** Natural Battery Test is stopped when battery voltage drops below Stop Voltage and Ignore Time has passed.
*** Natural Battery Test testing time in hours / minutes. The test ends successfully when the time limit is reached. The BT Ignore Time specifies the minimum value for this parameter.
*** Maximum battery discarge limit for Natural Battery Test in Ampere hours. The test ends successfully when the discharge limit is reached. Set to zero to disable the limit.
*** Defines whether Remote Battery Test is enabled.
*** When Enabled, RBT will remain active after start until time, discharge or voltage limit is reached, regardless of the state of the control signal. When Disabled, RBT will be stopped also when control signal deactivates.
*** Remote Battery Test is stopped when battery voltage drops below Stop Voltage and Ignore Time has passed.
*** Remote Battery Test testing time in hours / minutes. The test ends successfully when the time limit is reached. The BT Ignore Time specifies the minimum value for this parameter.
*** Maximum battery discarge limit for Remote Battery Test in Ampere hours. The test ends successfully when the discharge limit is reached. Set to zero to disable the limit.
*** Settling time in the beginning of the test during which Stop Voltage is ignored.
*** Battery Test is always stopped when battery voltage drops below Shutdown Voltage
*** Minimum charge time before Battery Test can be started after a mains fault.

group.name: LvdDefaults
group.group:
*** LVD Control mode defines the basis for connecting and disconnecting the LVD contactor. Voltage: system voltage. Time: mains fault duration. Discharge: battery discharge during mains fault.
*** This must be set according to the type of the LVD contactor used.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected when system voltage drops below this threshold.
*** LVD contactor is connected when system voltage rises above this threshold.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected after given amount of time has passed since beginning of a mains fault.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected after given amount of ampere-hours has been discharged from batteries.

*** LVD Control mode defines the basis for connecting and disconnecting the LVD contactor. Voltage: system voltage. Time: mains fault duration. Discharge: battery discharge during mains fault.
*** This must be set according to the type of the LVD contactor used.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected when system voltage drops below this threshold.
*** LVD contactor is connected when system voltage rises above this threshold.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected after given amount of time has passed since beginning of a mains fault.
*** LVD contactor is disconnected after given amount of ampere-hours has been discharged from batteries.

parameters.group:
*** Defines the default AC source of the bypass switch.
*** Defines the nominal voltage of the inverters.
*** Minimum mains AC voltage which bypass switch accepts before switching to inverter supply.
*** Maximum mains AC voltage which bypass switch accepts before switching to inverter supply.
*** Inverters DC supply low voltage disconnect voltage. If system DC voltage drops below this limit, the inverters will be shut down to save batteries.
*** Inverters DC supply low voltage pickup voltage. After a low voltage disconnect, the inverters will be activated again when system DC voltage exceeds this limit.
*** AC output voltage setpoint for the inverters.
*** AC output frequency for the inverters.
*** Internal over temperature alarm limit.
*** Enable/disable AC output Earth Fault Detection. Should not be enabled if there is a bypass module installed.

group.name: Sys
group.group:
*** Defines whether System Over Temperature is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for System Over Temperature.
*** Defines output relay list for System Over Temperature.
*** Temperature limit for System Over Temperature.

*** Defines whether Low System Voltage is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Low System Voltage.
*** Defines output relay list for Low System Voltage.
*** Voltage limit for Low System Voltage.

*** Defines whether High System Voltage is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for High System Voltage.
*** Defines output relay list for High System Voltage.
*** Voltage limit for High System Voltage.

*** Defines whether Mains Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Mains Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Mains Fault.

*** Defines whether Charge Voltage Deviation is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Charge Voltage Deviation.
*** Defines output relay list for Charge Voltage Deviation.
*** Maximum deviation percent from the charge voltage.

*** Defines whether Bypass Mains Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Bypass Mains Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Bypass Mains Fault.

*** Defines whether Phase Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Phase Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Phase Fault.

*** Defines whether Inverter System Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Inverter System Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Inverter System Fault.

*** Defines whether Rectifiers Overload is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifiers Overload.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifiers Overload.
*** Minimum number of redundant rectifiers for Rectifiers Overload.

*** Defines whether Inverters Overload is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Inverters Overload.
*** Defines output relay list for Inverters Overload.
*** Minimum number of redundant rectifiers for Inverters Overload.

*** Defines whether Bus Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Bus Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Bus Fault.

*** Defines whether DCP Bus Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for DCP Bus Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for DCP Bus Fault.

*** Defines whether Inventory Full is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Inventory Full.
*** Defines output relay list for Inventory Full.

*** Defines whether Earth Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Earth Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Earth Fault.
*** Earth fault alarm threshold resistance. The alarm is activated if the measured power line to PE resistance is less than the given value.

*** Defines whether Boost Charge Active is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Boost Charge Active.
*** Defines output relay list for Boost Charge Active.

*** Defines whether Configuration Conflict is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Configuration Conflict.
*** Defines output relay list for Configuration Conflict.

group.name: Mod
group.group:
*** Defines whether Rectifier Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifier Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifier Fault.

*** Defines whether Rectifier Over Voltage is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifier Over Voltage.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifier Over Voltage.

*** Defines whether Rectifier Over Temperature is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifier Over Temperature.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifier Over Temperature.

*** Defines whether Rectifier Mains Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifier Mains Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifier Mains Fault.

*** Defines whether Rectifier Wrong Voltage Version is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Rectifier Wrong Voltage Version.
*** Defines output relay list for Rectifier Wrong Voltage Version.

*** Defines whether Communication Error is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Communication Error.
*** Defines output relay list for Communication Error.

*** Defines whether Module Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Module Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Module Fault.

*** Defines whether Inverter Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Inverter Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Inverter Fault.

*** Defines whether Bypass Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Bypass Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Bypass Fault.

*** Defines whether NvRam Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for NvRam Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for NvRam Fault.

*** Defines whether Config Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Config Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Config Fault.

*** Defines whether Bad Firmware is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Bad Firmware.
*** Defines output relay list for Bad Firmware.

group.name: Batt
group.group:
*** Defines whether Automatic Boost Charge Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Automatic Boost Charge Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Automatic Boost Charge Fault.

*** Defines whether Battery Test Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Test Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Test Fault.

*** Defines whether Battery Block Low Voltage is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Block Low Voltage.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Block Low Voltage.
*** Voltage limit for Battery Block Low Voltage.

*** Defines whether Battery Block High Voltage is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Block High Voltage.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Block High Voltage.
*** Voltage limit for Battery Block High Voltage.

*** Defines whether Battery Over Temperature is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Over Temperature.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Over Temperature.
*** Temperature limit for Battery Over Temperature.

*** Defines whether Battery String Asymmetry is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery String Asymmetry.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery String Asymmetry.
*** Battery string asymmetry limit for Battery String Asymmetry.

group.name: Lvd
group.group:
*** Defines whether Load LVD Disconnect Warning is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Load LVD Disconnect Warning.
*** Defines output relay list for Load LVD Disconnect Warning.
*** Load LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated if voltage difference to disconnect voltage of Load LVD is lower than this value and Load LVD is in voltage control mode.
*** Load LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated when time to disconnect is less than this value and Load LVD is in time control mode.
*** Load LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated when Load LVD is in Discharge control mode and the difference of battery discharge and LVD Disconnect Ah Limit is less than this value.

*** Defines whether Load LVD Disconnect Imminent is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Load LVD Disconnect Imminent.
*** Defines output relay list for Load LVD Disconnect Imminent.

*** Defines whether Battery LVD Disconnect Warning is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery LVD Disconnect Warning.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery LVD Disconnect Warning.
*** Battery LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated if voltage difference to disconnect voltage of Battery LVD is lower than this value and Battery LVD is in voltage control mode.
*** Battery LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated when time to disconnect is less than this value and Battery LVD is in time control mode.
*** Battery LVD Disconnect Warning will be activated when Battery LVD is in Discharge control mode and the difference of battery discharge and LVD Disconnect Ah Limit is less than this value.

*** Defines whether Battery LVD Disconnect Imminent is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery LVD Disconnect Imminent.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery LVD Disconnect Imminent.

*** Defines whether Contactor Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Contactor Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Contactor Fault.

group.name: Dev
group.group:
*** Defines whether Battery Fuse Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Fuse Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Fuse Fault.

*** Defines whether Load Fuse Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Load Fuse Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Load Fuse Fault.

*** Defines whether Current Shunt Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Current Shunt Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Current Shunt Fault.

*** Defines whether Battery Temperature Sensor Fault is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Battery Temperature Sensor Fault.
*** Defines output relay list for Battery Temperature Sensor Fault.

*** Defines whether No Battery Temperature Sensor is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for No Battery Temperature Sensor.
*** Defines output relay list for No Battery Temperature Sensor.

*** Defines whether No System Temperature Sensor is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for No System Temperature Sensor.
*** Defines output relay list for No System Temperature Sensor.

*** Defines whether Ext. Alarm Group 1 is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Ext. Alarm Group 1.
*** Defines output relay list for Ext. Alarm Group 1.
*** Defines list of external alarm inputs for this alarm group.

*** Defines whether Ext. Alarm Group 2 is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Ext. Alarm Group 2.
*** Defines output relay list for Ext. Alarm Group 2.
*** Defines list of external alarm inputs for this alarm group.

*** Defines whether Ext. Alarm Group 3 is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Ext. Alarm Group 3.
*** Defines output relay list for Ext. Alarm Group 3.
*** Defines list of external alarm inputs for this alarm group.

*** Defines whether Ext. Alarm Group 4 is enabled.
*** Defines activation delay time for Ext. Alarm Group 4.
*** Defines output relay list for Ext. Alarm Group 4.
*** Defines list of external alarm inputs for this alarm group.

parameters.group:
*** Enable/Disable use of NTP time server.
*** IP address of currently selected time server. Can be a fully-qualified host name or numeric IP address.
*** IP address of user defined time server. Can be a fully-qualified host name or numeric IP address.
*** Current time zone.
